lexUnit.name: scamper.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: run with quick light steps, especially through fear or excitement.

sentence.text: We 'd already spotted several rabbits scampering about .
The boatman scampered across to the opposite gunwale , turned the boat , turned it again and set off on a long glide which took them close in along the bridge .
I can picture the convoy now : the little navigating jeep in front , the solid three-tonners rolling along steadily , and the jeeps scampering about at the back .

About fifty or sixty yards away on the right-band side of the road a mortar bomb burst in the hedgerow , followed a few seconds later by four German soldiers carrying automatic weapons jumping from the hedgerow and scampering along the road .

Privates scampered around trying to locate missing items of personal kit , NCOs were supervising the application of camouflage cream on the faces of section personnel , and squadron officers were discussing the final plans for the training .
As he conducted Divine Service in the old Seagoe Parish Church his dogs scampered around the churchyard .
Finches , grey wagtails , woodpeckers and numerous other birds filled the air with song while the friendly lemmings scampered around showing little fear of humans .
Anna May buttoned her coat and scampered away , swarming like a monkey over the wall at the back of the alley and vanishing into the night .
Did Luke appreciate all this ? she thought suddenly , watching as a rabbit lifted its head a moment and then scampered away .
` Hey , " shouted Penny , but before she could protest further man and monkey had scampered away into the crowd .
The dog either understood the threat or concluded its barking was having no effect , for it scampered away to an enamel bath stranded in the middle of a neighbouring field .
In a second the others had scampered back and jumped into the seething mass of dogs .
Children who bravely ventured into the darkness soon came scampering back .
She turned around and scampered back across the footpath to the gate , squeezed under and crept to the dish .
After about an hour , her two babies scamper back to their den , she rejoins her mate and the two walk off to resume grazing , perhaps a considerable distance away .
` I 'm terribly sorry about your aunt 's jewellery , " Charity said , verbally scampering back to safe ground as fast as she could .
She scampered down the bank after the dog .
She hurried downstage and scampered down the makeshift gangway to the auditorium floor .
One of the apes that lived among the rooftops of the city scampered down and picked up the peel , then raced back up to his vantage point beside the eaves .
Two buskers were playing banjos , walking up and down the line , while a dwarf scampered in and out of the waiting cinema-goers with an outstretched hand , cajoling money from the queue .
The church door opened and Crim , the young urchin , scampered in .

Before the school teacher could answer , there was another rap on the door and Beasley scampered in like an overgrown puppy , casting inquisitive glances at Jim Lancaster and the two police officers .
Suddenly the dogs scampered off , and she saw them jumping up to greet a dark figure .
I forgot eggs , " he called , and scampered off down the stairs to get some from an early dairy around the corner .
Athelstan slipped him a penny , patted him lightly on the head , and the boy scampered off .
I landed on all fours , stayed on all fours , then scampered off into the blackness .
At once the clown scampered off into the dark .
A beadle in his striped gown tried to arrest him but the ` devil " scampered off to the cheers of the crowd .
Sam scampered on ahead of them and waited at Dobbs ' field .
Pushing free , Ashley spun round to see Thomas scampering merrily out barefoot on to the terrace .
Then she rose to her feet , as Kirsty scampered out i4to the hall , and , adjusting the collar of her cream silk blouse , walked on measured steps towards the window .
They took one look at him and scampered over the fence as quickly as rats over the timbers of a sinking ship .
He looked pale and serious as his eyes scampered round the room until they found the telephone .
Four photographers scampered round the podium , halting to squint through their viewfinders and freeze the scene with their flashlights .
The supplicant scampered round to the chairman 's better side , and said , more loudly than he perhaps intended , the microphone picking up his words quite clearly , ` Say no to the bugger . "
Warriors including Ollokot meanwhile scampered up the slope and mounted a defensive fire into the soldiers ' flanks from improvised rifle-pits .
I stood engrossed by this until I heard the rocking chair creak behind me , and at that I scampered up after them .
She scampered up the bank through the weeds to the footpath .
He scampered up the outer staircase and disappeared into the hall .
The two men laughed as the boy scampered up the steps .
The friar followed him dolefully across the street as Sir John scampered direct as an arrow for the Holy Lamb of God .
The specialists tend to live rather quiet , often secretive lives , while the opportunists scamper hither and thither , always on the lookout for a new kind of meal .
Soon after our conversation was interrupted by my flailing attempts to follow Grond while Pat scampered after me on what appeared to be a completely different route .
IF he had been running a 100 metre sprint final , little Louis Stevens could n't have scampered any faster yesterday .
Under the hum of stroboscopic strip lighting , fidgeting , rodentine psychology students scampered this way and that , clutching streamers of computer printout , clipboards and calculators .
Telephones still jangled , commands were barked , soldiers scampered to obey .
Almost scampering after him , Belinda saw that there was only one other couple left in the café now .
` I 'm not the slightest bit interested in you -- or what you wear ! " she hissed at him beneath the sound of the children 's laughter as they jumped off the bed , and scampered about the room .
A grey squirrel , spry after its winter sleep , startled Ben by scampering across his path .
Pedestrians scampered blindly across the road to catch waiting buses , the cars jerked ahead a few yards every time the traffic lights turned to green .
Cranston turned and quietly cursed as the madman scampered across the snow to greet them , yelping like an affectionate dog .
Then he lurched heavily to his right , scampering behind a garden shed and scrabbling through the broken fencing into the grounds next door .
His large family lived on the floor above and scampered between hotel and home by climbing through a window and up a fire escape .
As the old woman pushed the hand-cart across the yard a number of children scampered from various heaps to gather around her , gabbling .
He leapt out of bed , grabbed his bathrobe and scampered from the room .
Watching as the twins scampered from the room , Laura was surprised to find Ross 's arm sliding about her waist .
Nobody laughed , and Otto assured her in his best smoothie tones that said beast was scampering in the Elysian fields and piddling all over archangels ' sandals .
His horse put up waterfowl and once disturbed a whole field of rabbits that scampered in panic towards the hedgerows .
About a mile upstream Ramses drew the boat into a side pool , scampered into the shallows and lashed the boat to a tree .
She and her friends scampered into the undergrowth where there were plenty of grubs for all .

Woodlice were miniature armadillos ; tomato-coloured mites scampered on the walls as if the brick was burning their feet ; herds of striped and chequered snails glued up their doorways each autumn ; and sluggish , fragile caterpillars , irritatingly , mummified themselves during the one interesting period of their lives .
Sammy scampered leisurely in front of him while he stopped intermittently to pick up sweet chestnuts on the way .
Nearby ewes then ran away , followed by lambs that scampered after their mothers .
Robert waved them on , and they scampered after the rest of the class .
As her gloved hand found the switch , Darren scampered past her , up to the wrought iron grille which separated the passage from the nave of the church .
` Late again , Scott , " he would say as Adam scampered past him in the corridor .
Two trains come in simultaneously and Hancock simply scampers through one and into the corner seat of the other , while the commuters are struggling to enter .
He scampered nimbly ahead through the crowd with his friends -- leaving us trapped behind a leisurely army of elderly women .
As nightmares scampered through Flyte 's imagination , Dean 's impassive face began to blur behind the glass .
Tiny tell-tale marks showed where voles and mice had scampered through grass tunnels roofed with snow to reach the safety of their homes .
And I , where was I , during those years when chipmunks scampered through the undercarriage of the battered little Kobold ?
Cleo scampered to the edge of the clearing and looked back .
Mitch scampered under the scaffolding and Garland followed .
